name: Red Team Testing (RT) #3 - Execution of the test
displayName: Red Team Testing (RT) #3 - Execution of the test
description:
| Phase | Step | Outcome |
| ------------- |:-------------:| -----:|
| Red Team Testing Report  | 3 of 3 | Final report with the results of the test executed in the `Entity` environment |

# Tasks

- `Task #1 -  Execution`
- `Task #2 - During the execution`
- `Task #3 - After the execution`

# Execution of the entire test

The final  phase is the execution of the test developed previously in the `Entity` environment. At this point, the red team will try to get all the flags that the threat intelligence team proposed in its report. The ultimate goal is to get into the systems to be able to show that there are risks to be able to work on them later.

# Outcome

The final report should have the following information:

* Executive summary
* Scenarios executed with TTPs mapped
* Flags captured
* Recommendations 
* Improvement opportunities

tasks.title: Task #3 - After the execution
tasks.description:
# Dependencies

This task has dependency on `Task #2 - During the execution`.

# Goal

The last step of the test is the creation of the final report for the `Entity`. At this point, the red team should have carried out all the previously proposed scenarios.

As described in the case description, the report should contain the following information.

* Executive summary
* Scenarios executed with TTPs mapped
* Flags captured
* Recommendations 
* Improvement opportunities

After deliver the final report, the red team should do the following tasks.

* Coordinate a review with the blue team to identify what was detected by the blue team and what wasn't detected.
* Schedule a replay of the test together with the blue team after they have applied new detection measures.

tasks.title: Task #2 - During the execution
tasks.description:
# Dependencies

This task has dependency on `Task #1 - Execution`.

# Goal

There must be continuous communication **between the red team and the threat intelligence team.** This communication is carried out to define new objectives or carry out new intelligence requirements. It could result in some of the following outcomes.

* New intelligence provided from threat intelligence to red team
* New systems compromised by the red team, giving this information to threat intelligence to request for new requirements and intelligence generation
* New ways to compromise by the red team after obtain new intelligence feedback

Also, is important that the red team has continuous communication with the white team, reporting all the steps taken.

tasks.title: Task #1 -  Execution
tasks.description:
# Dependencies

This task has dependency on `Case #2 - Testing Methodology and scenarios`.

# Goal

All the scenarios created either by the threat intelligence team or red team should be executed. If obstacles occur during the test, the red team should **show its creativity** (as advanced attackers would). 

Irrespective of the methodology used by the RT provider, the test should be conducted in a controlled manner, taking a stage-by-stage approach, and in a way that does not bring risks to the entity and its critical functions. It is important for the White Team to be continuously informed about progress being made at each stage, as soon as a flag or target is in sight, or at least when the red team provider has achieved the "capture the flag" moment.
